Description: 14 beads of different shape and material. A: Small amulet in the shape of a flower with a flat base and a textured surface made of faience, in the middle a dark (black) dot, the rest is turquoise, the lug at the top is broken off. B: Poppy-seed pendant made of a light translucent carnelian, broken off at the perforation, relatively stylized in shape. C: Small double-conical bead made of red jasper, not very well smoothed, still shows several facets. D: Seven disc-shaped beads 1 made of white, 3 made of turquoise faience, 1 made of white stone. E: Fragment of a cylindrical segmented bead made of turquoise faience, two segments preserved. F: One small ring-shaped bead made of a yellow glassy material. G: Two spherical beads made of turquoise faience.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
